svt_smbus_master_monitor_def_cov_callback Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_smbus_master_monitor_def_cov_callback:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class is extended from the coverage data callback class. This class includes default cover groups.


Public Member Functions

function void  new ( svt_i2c_configuration cfg , string name = "svt_smbus_master_monitor_def_cov_callback" )

Member CoverGroup Documentation

  covergroup
 svt_smbus_master_monitor_def_cov_callback::cg_smbus_master_arp_state

covergroup cg_smbus_master_arp_state @ ( smbus_arp_event ) ;
          option.name = "cg_smbus_master_arp_state";
  option.per_instance = 1;
//----------------------------------------------------cp_members---------------------------------------------------
  cp_arp_command : coverpoint xact.data[1] {
    bins b_prepare_to_arp_commad = {'h01};
   bins b_gen_reset_device_command = {'h02};
   bins b_gen_get_udid_commad = {'h03};
   bins b_assign_addr_command = {'h04};
 }
endgroup

 svt_smbus_master_monitor_def_cov_callback::cg_smbus_master_packet

covergroup cg_smbus_master_packet @ ( smbus_xact_event ) ;
    option.name = "cg_smbus_master_packet";
  option.per_instance = 1;
//----------------------------------------------------cp_members---------------------------------------------------
 cp_slave_address : coverpoint xact.addr {
    bins b_slave_address_range = {[0 : 255]};
 }
  cp_read_write_field : coverpoint xact.read_write{
    bins b_read_command = {1};
   bins b_write_command = {0};
 }
  cp_command_field : coverpoint cmd_type {
    bins b_write_byte_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR_BYTE_CMD};
   bins b_write_word_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR_WORD_CMD};
   bins b_write_32byte_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR32_CMD};
   bins b_write_64byte_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR64_CMD};
   bins b_write_block_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR_BLOCK_CMD};
   bins b_read_byte_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD_BYTE_CMD};
   bins b_read_word_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD_WORD_CMD};
   bins b_read_32byte_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD32_CMD};
   bins b_read_64byte_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD64_CMD};
   bins b_read_block_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD_BLOCK_CMD};
   bins b_process_block_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_PROCESS_BLOCK_CMD};
   bins b_process_call_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_PROCESS_CMD};
   bins b_write_byte_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR_BYTE_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_write_word_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR_WORD_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_write_32byte_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR32_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_write_64byte_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR64_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_write_block_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_WR_BLOCK_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_read_byte_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD_BYTE_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_read_word_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD_WORD_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_read_32byte_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD32_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_read_64byte_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD64_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_read_block_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_RD_BLOCK_CMD_PEC};

   bins b_process_call_pec_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_PROCESS_CMD_PEC};
   bins b_host_notify_command = { svt_i2c_enum_pkg:: SMBUS_HOST_NOTIFY_CMD};
   }
  cp_byte_count : coverpoint smbus_byte_count iff (en_byte_count_cov == 1) {
    bins b_byte_count_min = {0};
   bins b_byte_count_range = {[1 : 254]};
   bins b_byte_count_max = {255};
 }
  cp_pec_field : coverpoint smbus_pec_value iff (en_pec_value_cov == 1) {
    bins b_pec_field_range = {[0 : 255]};
 }
  endgroup

  covergroup
 svt_smbus_master_monitor_def_cov_callback::cg_smbus_master_timeout_values

covergroup cg_smbus_master_timeout_values @ ( smbus_xact_event ) ;
    option.name = "cg_smbus_timeout_values";
  option.per_instance = 1;
//----------------------------------------------------cp_members---------------------------------------------------
  cp_t_buf : coverpoint smbus_t_buf_time {
    bins b_t_buf_min = {4};
   bins b_t_buf_range = {[4:$]};
 }
  cp_t_low : coverpoint smbus_t_low_time {
    bins b_t_low_min = {4};
   bins b_t_low_range = {[4:$]};
 }
  cp_t_high : coverpoint smbus_t_high_time {
    bins b_t_high_min = {4};
   bins b_t_high_range = {[5:49]};
   bins b_t_high_max = {50};
 }
 // These timeout values take only the min and max values. Should these be included in the covergae?
